intro: Caryopteris odorata var. integrifolia, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It features aromatic, narrow leaves that are typically lance-shaped and have smooth margins. The plant produces clusters of blue-violet flowers in late summer, which attract pollinators like butterflies and bees. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
